Senate doesn't need to eliminate filibuster. Better solution is to work more than 3 days per week. Allow time for debate and deliberation.
The real problem in the Senate isn't the filibuster. What we really need is for Senate to be the Senate: an open, deliberative body.
What a healthy Senate lacks in efficiency, it makes up for with open, robust deliberation.
The filibuster is about leverage, and that leverage is essential to maintaining equality and engendering deliberation among Senators.
Everything in the Senate is rooted in occupational equality of all Senators - filibuster protects this.
The Senate is broken, but the filibuster has almost nothing to do with it.
Currently defending the need to preserve the Senate filibuster with @bdomenechpic.twitter.com/K4sChFQ3xW

Government-driven inequality is the reason why six of the ten wealthiest counties in America are now suburbs of Washington, D.C.
#Obamacare is an inequality Godzilla that has robbed working families of their insurance, their doctors, their wages and their jobs.
Inequality is changing laws without congressional approval, & spying on Americans without constitutional authority.http://youtu.be/3mE6qHNNbhk
Inequality is the federal government hurting rural communities, especially in the West, by controlling and mismanaging public lands.
Inequality is denying citizens the right to define marriage in their states as traditionally or as broadly as their diverse values dictate.
Inequality is blocking thousands of middle-class energy jobs as a favor to partisan donors & radical environmental activists.
#Inequality is guaranteeing insurance companies taxpayer bailouts if #Obamacare cuts into their profits. http://youtu.be/3mE6qHNNbhk
Inequality is penalizing low-income parents for getting married, or getting better jobs:http://youtu.be/3mE6qHNNbhk
Inequality – real inequality - is trapping poor children in failing schools to benefit bureaucrats and union bosses: http://youtu.be/3mE6qHNNbhk
"I’d like to speak especially to those Americans who may feel they have been forgotten by both political parties."http://ow.ly/t3x0p
Government creates inequality when it takes rights & opportunities away from American people & gives them to politicians & bureaucrats.
Tonight, the President’s lofty rhetoric on inequality ignores the fact that his administration has left poor & middle-class families behind.
Inequality crisis = poor trapped in poverty, middle-class insecurity, and cronyist privilege at the top. http://ow.ly/t3w3U
We face an inequality crisis — one to which the President has paid lip-service, but seems uninterested in truly confronting or correcting.
Today, Americans know in their hearts that something is wrong as the “American Dream” is falling out of reach for far too many of us.
The founders made a point at Boston Harbor, but they made history in Philadelphia’s Independence Hall.
In America, the test of any political movement is not what that movement is against, but what it is for.
It took founders 14 long years to get from Boston to Philadelphia, where they created, with our Constitution, the government they did want.

I just voted no on final passage for the Gang of 8 comprehensive immigration reform bill:http://ow.ly/ms9Ma
My floor speech from earlier today to oppose #Go8 bill: http://ow.ly/mrYPX  Click on link and help me RT if you share my concerns.
I support immigration reform. But #Go8 is not immigration reform. It is big government dysfunction. I am voting no: http://ow.ly/i/2t3AI
There's simply no legitimate reason why we have to pass a one-size-fits-all 1,200-page, take-it-or-leave-it #immigration bill.
the only reason #immigration reform is so controversial is because the Senate refuses to pass it one piece at a time.
The House appears to have learned from #Go8 dysfunction and wants no part of this.  They are passing step-by-step reforms.
The special interests had a huge hand in writing the #Go8 bill while the American people had no role:http://ow.ly/mrUpa
The so-called comprehensive approach has been utterly discredited. #Go8 bill reaffirms why vast majority of Americans distrust Washington.
The #Go8 process has revealed all the problems inherent in passing massive pieces of legislation that try to fix all of problems at once.
For grand finale, the #Go8 proponents substituted what is effectively a brand-new bill instead of the one we've been debating for 2 months.
For a 1,200-page bill we were allowed exactly nine roll call votes to amend #Go8 before the process was shut down.
They said there would be regular order for #Go8 on the floor of the senate, but that turned out to be a false promise as well.
During committee markup Democrats & #Go8 Republicans voted as a block to defeat virtually all substantive amendments to improve the bill.
We were told that if we didn't like what was in #Go8 that we'd have an opportunity to fix it. But that wasn't true either.
From day one, the country was misled about what was in #Go8 bill. The talking points never matched bill's reality:http://ow.ly/mrxUR
As a matter of process, senators should be embarrassed about how #Go8 bill has moved through the senate.http://ow.ly/mrxya
According to CBO, #Go8 will reduce illegal immigration by just a mere 25% over the next ten years: reason alone to scrap entire bill.
The #Go8 bill transfers too much authority & discretion to the executive branch, exacerbating an already widespread problem in federal gov.
The #Go8 bill remains grossly unfair to those who have languished in our current legal immigration system for decades.
The #Go8 bill cuts the American people out by cutting out congressional oversight of pathway to citizenship process:http://ow.ly/mruMs
#Go8 bill is full of promises to beef up border security, but it makes no assurances.http://ow.ly/mru3A
As a matter of public policy, #Go8 fails to meet many of the goals that we set to meet at the beginning of the process.
The #Go8 bill we have before us today is an enormous disappointment. The American people deserve better:http://ow.ly/mrtiB
